footnotes  1  editors note  adopted  rearranged renumbered and revised the charter articles ixxiii as articles ixvii the editor has treated this ordinance as repealing and readopting the charter the former charter derived from an election of dec 30 1953  and from iii119 adopted   iii16 adopted nov 8 1961   adopted sept 18 1967  1 2 adopted nov 4 1970  18 adopted nov 8 1972   adopted nov 6 1974  ad adopted   and adopted jan 20 2001 article i  form of government corporate name the inhabitants of the city of groves with the boundaries as now established or as hereafter established in the manner provided in this charter shall continue to be and are hereby constituted a body politic and corporate and to be known by the name and style of city of groves type of government the municipal government provided by this charter shall be known as the councilmanager government pursuant to its provisions and subject only to its limitations imposed by the state constitution and by this charter all powers of the city shall be vested in an elective council composed of four 4 councilmembers and a mayor hereafter referred to as the council or city council which shall enact local legislation adopt budgets determine policies and appoint the city manager who in turn shall be held responsible to the city council for the execution of the laws and the administration of the government of the city all powers of the city shall be exercised in the manner prescribed by this charter or if the manner be not prescribed then in such a manner as may be prescribed by ordinance so long as there is no conflict with the general laws of the state of texas boundaries the boundaries and limits of the city of groves shall be the same as have been heretofore established and now exist and as may be established and changed hereafter the city council shall have the power by ordinance to fix boundary limits of the city of groves and to provide for the alteration and extension of said boundary limits and the annexation of additional territory lying adjacent to the city provided however that such ordinance must be passed by a fourfifths  45  majority of the entire membership of the city council when any additional territory has been so annexed same shall be a part of the city of groves for municipal purposes and the property situated therein shall bear its pro rata part of the taxes levied by the city and the inhabitants thereof shall be entitled to all the rights and privileges of all the citizens and shall be bound by the acts ordinances resolutions and regulations of the city an official map of the city shall be maintained which shows the boundaries of the city and its extraterritorial jurisdiction a copy to the map shall be kept in the office of the city clerk creation of ward boundaries the city council shall by ordinance divide the city into four 4 wards for the purpose of electing a bona fide resident from each as councilmember article ii  general powers of city general the city of groves as such body politic and corporate shall have perpetual succession may sue and be sued and shall have all the powers granted to cities by the constitution and laws of the state of texas together with all the implied powers necessary to carry in execution all the powers granted the city may acquire property within or without its boundaries for any municipal purpose in fee simple or any lesser interest or estate by purchase gift devise lease or condemnation and may sell lease hold manage and control any property now owned by it or which it hereafter may acquire and may construct own lease operate and regulate public utilities  may assess levy and collect taxes for general and special purposes on all lawful subjects of taxation  may borrow money on the faith and credit of the city by the issuance and sale of bonds or notes of the city  may appropriate the money of the city for all lawful purposes  may regulate and control the use for whatever purpose of the streets and other public places  may make and enforce all police health sanitary and other regulations and may pass such ordinances as may be expedient for the protection and maintenance of good government peace and welfare of the city for the performance of the functions thereof for the order and security of its inhabitants and to protect the peace lives health and property of the inhabitants  and may provide suitable penalties for the violation of any ordinance enacted by the city of groves  and except as prohibited by the constitution of this state or restricted by this charter the city may exercise all municipal powers functions rights privileges and immunities of every name and nature whatsoever general powers adopted the enumeration of the particular powers in this charter shall not be held or deemed to be exclusive but in addition to the powers enumerated herein or implied hereby or appropriate to the exercise of such powers the city shall have and may exercise all power of local selfgovernment and all other powers which under the constitution and laws of the state of texas it would be competent for this charter specifically to enumerate the city of groves shall have and exercise all the powers enumerated in title 28 of the revised civil statutes of the state of texas of 1925 and amendments thereto and hereafter enacted eminent domain the city shall have the full power and right to exercise the power of eminent domain when necessary or desirable to carry out any of the powers conferred upon it by this charter or by the constitution and laws of the state of texas the city may exercise the power of eminent domain in any manner authorized or permitted by the constitution and laws of this state or in the manner and form that may be provided for by ordinance of the governing body of the city the power of eminent domain hereby conferred shall include the right of the city to take the fee and so condemn and such power and authority shall include the right to condemn public property for such purposes the city shall have and possess the power of condemnation for any municipal or public purposes even though not specifically enumerated in this charter streets sidewalks bridges and other public property the city of groves shall have the power to construct acquire improve modify pay for maintain control regulate the use thereof vacate close and operate all streets sidewalks bridges alleys and other public ways within the city as permitted by law sanitary sewer system the city shall have the power to provide for a sanitary sewer system to require property owners to connect their premises with such sewer system and to provide for penalties for failure to make sanitary sewer connections public utilities the city shall have the power to buy own construct maintain and operate utilities and to manufacture and distribute electricity gas or anything else that may be needed or used by the public and shall have such further powers that may now or hereafter be granted under the constitution and laws of the state of texas a operation and control all municipally owned utilities shall be operated by the city in such a manner as to be selfsustaining insofar as is practical and shall not be converted into general revenue producing agencies of the city the city council may transfer funds of municipally owned utilities to the general fund of the city provided however that the amount so transferred shall not exceed annually twenty percent 20% of the gross revenue of said utilities for the previous fiscal year such sums so transferred shall be in lieu of taxes street rentals or other contributions to general administrative expenses of the city provided however nothing herein is to apply to the operation of charitable and educational facilities operated by the city such transfers shall be made annually and shall be noncumulative b accounts of municipally owned utilities accounts shall be kept for each public utility owned or operated by the city in such manner as to show the true and complete financial results of such city ownership and operation including all assets appropriately subdivided by classes depreciation reserve other reserves and surplus also revenues operating expenses including depreciation interest payments rental and other distribution of annual income the accounts shall show the actual capital cost to the city of each public utility owned also the costs of all extensions additions and improvements and the source of the funds expended for such capital purposes they shall show as nearly as possible the cost of any service furnished to or rendered by any such utility to any other city or governmental department the city council shall annually cause to be made and published a report showing the financial results of such city ownership and operation giving the information specified in this such additional data as the city council shall deem expedient c sale or lease of municipally owned utilities no public utility park andor swimming pool owned by the city of groves shall ever be sold or leased for a period longer than five 5 years until such sale or lease is authorized by a majority vote of the qualified voters of the city  nor shall same be encumbered for more than five thousand dollars $500000 except for purchase money or to refund any existing indebtedness lawfully created until authorized in like manner d election when properties named in of this to be sold or leased for a period of more than five 5 years or encumbered for more than five thousand dollars $500000 as provided in said the city council shall by ordinance call an election submitting said proposition to the qualified voters of the city of groves  the time and places of holding the election shall be designated in said ordinance  and said election shall be held not less than fifteen 15 nor more than thirty 30 days from the passage of said ordinance notice of said election shall be given by posting a copy of said ordinance in each of the election precincts in the city and at city hall  such ordinance shall also be published on the same day in each of two 2 successive weeks in the official newspaper of the city of groves  the date of the first publication to be not less than fourteen 14 days prior to the date set for the elections e form of ballots the question to sell lease or mortgage shall be submitted on ballots which shall describe the property to be sold leased or mortgaged and the terms of the sale lease or mortgage and shall have printed below the description and terms for the sale lease mortgage against the sale lease mortgage no special election shall be called within sixty 60 days of a general municipal election for the submission of a proposition to sell lease or mortgage such property but same shall be submitted as herein provided at said general election extraterritorial authority the city shall have the power to define all nuisances and hazards to life health and property and prescribe controls for the same within the city limits and outside the city limits for a distance of 5000 feet acquisition of property the city shall have the power and authority for any municipal purpose to acquire by purchase gift devise deed condemnation or otherwise any character of property within or without the municipal boundaries  and the police power and all ordinances of the city shall cover such property both within and without the boundaries of the city insurance the city council may provide for group health and life insurance coverage for city employees article iii  city council number and term the city council shall be composed of a mayor and four 4 councilmembers elected at large in a manner provided for under of this charter the term of office shall be for two 2 years and until their respective successors be elected and qualified the terms of mayor and councilmembers in evennumbered wards will expire in evennumbered years  and the terms of councilmembers in oddnumbered wards will expire in oddnumbered years qualifications the mayor and each of the councilmembers shall be a citizen of the united states of america and a qualified elector of the state of texas and shall have resided within the corporate limits of the city for at least six 6 months preceding the date of the election for which heshe is a candidate a member of the council ceasing to possess any of these qualifications or convicted of a felony while in office shall immediately forfeit hisher office other than the mayor not more than one 1 councilmember shall be a resident of the same ward salary the annual salary of the mayor shall be five hundred dollars $50000 and the salary of each of the councilmembers shall be ten dollars $1000 for each meeting attended but not to exceed three hundred dollars $30000 for any one 1 year such salaries may be changed by ordinance however the mayor and each member of the city council that enacted such ordinance shall not receive any increased salary thereunder until after the expiration of their current term of office mayor the mayor shall preside at the meetings of the council and shall be recognized as the head of the city government for all ceremonial purposes and by the governor for purposes of military law but shall have no regular administrative duties unless otherwise provided for in other this charter the mayor shall be entitled to vote upon all matters considered by the council but shall have no veto power mayor pro tempore the city council shall elect one 1 of its members mayor pro tempore pro tem who shall perform the duties of the mayor in the case of absence or disability of the mayor  and if a vacancy shall occur shall become acting mayor until the vacancy is filled as provided in of this the charter vacancies if a vacancy should occur in the office of councilmember or in the office of mayor such vacancy shall be filled in the following manner a if any vacancy occurs within ninety 90 days of a general election the vacancy shall not be filled until the general election in the case of a vacancy in the office of mayor the mayor pro tem shall serve in such capacity until the vacancy is filled at the general election b if a vacancy occurs in the office of mayor longer than ninety 90 days before the next general election the office of mayor shall be filled by one 1 of the councilmembers elected by the members of the council the mayor so appointed shall serve until the next general election c if a vacancy occurs in the office of councilmember the remaining councilmembers and mayor shall appoint by a majority vote a qualified citizen from the ward in which the vacancy occurred to serve until the next regular election at which election a councilmember shall be elected for such place for the remainder of the two 2 year term if any d if two 2 or more vacancies occur in the offices of councilmembers within a fortyfive 45 day period or if one 1 or more vacancies occur in the offices of councilmember and the mayor within a fortyfive 45 day period at a time longer than ninety 90 days before the next general election a special election must be called by the remaining members of the city council within fortyfive 45 days to fill all such vacancies unless an appointment to fill the first vacancy has already been made in which case such appointee shall continue to hold office for hisher appointed term but a special election shall be called to fill the remaining vacancy or vacancies for the remainder of the respective terms the appointment of a councilmember to fill the office of mayor does not constitute a vacancy requiring a special election meetings the first meeting of each newly elected council shall be held within thirty 30 days following an election and the qualification of the newly elected councilmembers thereafter the council shall meet as they deem necessary but at least one 1 time each month special meetings of the council may be called at the request of the mayor city manager or three 3 members of the council three 3 or more of the councilmembers shall constitute a quorum for the transaction of business all regular meetings of the council shall be held in accordance with the texas open meetings act procedure the city council shall determine its own rules and order of business it shall keep a true and correct journal of all of its proceedings  said journal shall be open to public inspection as provided under the texas public information act investigations the city council or any person or committee appointed by the city council for the purpose of conducting an investigation shall have the power to inquire into the conduct of any department office agency or officer of the city  to make investigations as to the city affairs and for that purpose may subpoena witnesses administer oaths and compel the production of books papers and other evidence material to said inquiry the city council shall provide by ordinance the penalty for contempt in refusing to obey any such subpoena or failure to produce books papers and other evidence and shall have the power to punish such contempt in a manner provided by ordinance article iv  elections laws governing city elections all city elections shall be governed except as otherwise provided by the charter in accordance with the texas election general and municipal elections so far as same may be applicable thereto  and in the event there should be any failure to the general laws or this charter to provide for some feature of the city elections then the city council shall have the power to provide for such deficiency  and no informalities in conducting a city election shall invalidate same if it be conducted fairly and in substantial compliance with the general laws where applicable and the charter and ordinances of the city general municipal elections the regular election for the choice of mayor and members of the council as provided in shall be held each year on the first tuesday following the first monday in november the council may by resolution order a special election fix the time for holding same and provide all means for holding such special elections council ballots the names of all candidates for mayor or the council as hereinbefore provided except such as may have withdrawn died or become ineligible shall be printed on the official ballot with or without party designations if two 2 candidates have the same surnames or have names so similar as to be likely to cause confusion the addresses of the places of residence shall be placed on the ballot the order in which the names of such candidates are to be printed on the ballot shall be determined by a drawing as provided by the state election   election of councilmembers by majority at the general municipal election the candidates for the office of councilmember to the number to be elected and for the office of mayor who shall have received the majority of votes cast in such elections shall be declared elected should any candidate fail to receive a majority of votes at the general election for the office for which heshe is a candidate the council shall immediately order a special election to be held no less than twenty 20 days nor more than thirty 30 days after the result of the regular election has been declared at which special election the names only of the two 2 candidates receiving the highest number of votes at the general election for the office for which they were candidates shall be printed on the ballots or machines with or without party designation and submitted to the qualified voters for election  and the candidate receiving the majority of votes at such special election for the office for which heshe was a candidate shall be duly elected primary elections and nominations candidates for the offices of mayor and councilmember may be selected by primary election where authorized by the general laws of the state of texas  and the names of such candidates may be certified to the city clerk by the chairman of the party conducting such primary  and the same shall be sufficient to entitle said names to be placed on the official ballot or machines as candidates of said political parties candidates any qualified elector may have hisher name placed on the official ballot or machine as a candidate for the office of mayor or councilmember by filing with the city clerk at least thirty 30 days prior to the date of the election a sworn application that said candidate meets all the qualifications prescribed by this charter for a person to hold office there shall be a filing fee which shall be set by the city council the application shall be verified before an office qualified to administer oaths election officers and canvassing returns the election judge and other election officials necessary for conducting all such elections shall be appointed by the council and shall be qualified voters of the election precinct in which they are to serve the election judges shall certify their count of the ballots attaching the tally sheet to their certificate and deliver the election records to the city clerk in a sealed envelope within the time required by the texas election council shall meet and canvass the election returns and officially declare the result of the election in accordance with the texas election   listing of candidates printing ballots absentee voting the city clerk shall thirty 30 days prior to the election post in a conspicuous place in city hall a complete list of all candidates for the elective offices of the city of groves the official ballot shall be printed not less than twenty 20 days before the date of the election absentee voting shall conform to state law article v  city manager appointment and qualifications the city council shall appoint a city manager by a majority vote of the entire membership of the council the city manager shall be the chief administrative and executive officer of the city and shall be responsible to the city council for the administration of all the affairs of the city heshe shall be chosen by the council solely on the basis of hisher executive and administrative training experience and ability and need not when appointed be a resident of the city of groves but within six 6 months after being appointed the city manager shall have established hisher residency within the city of groves  and during hisher tenure of office heshe shall reside within the city the city manager shall provide a bond with such surety and in such amount as the council may require the premium on such bond shall be paid by the city no member of the council shall during the term for which heshe is elected be chosen as city manager or acting city manager term and salary the city manager may be removed at the will and pleasure of the council by a majority vote of the entire membership of the council if removed after serving six 6 months the city manager may demand and shall be granted written charges within a period of seven 7 days and the right to be heard thereon at a public meeting of the council within a period of twentyone 21 days or prior to the date on which the final removal shall take effect whichever period is less  but pending such hearing the council may suspend the city manager from office the action of the council in suspending or removing the city manager shall be final it being the intention of this charter to vest all authority and fix all responsibility for such suspension or removal in the council in case of the absence or disability of the city manager the council may designate some qualified person to perform the duties of the office during such absence or disability the city manager shall receive such compensation as may be fixed by the council powers and duties of the city manager the powers and duties of the city manager shall be as follows a appoint and remove all heads of departments and all subordinate officers and employees of the city except as otherwise provided by this charter and except as heshe may authorize the head of a department or office to appoint and remove subordinates in such department or office the decision of the city manager or other appointing officer shall be final and there shall be no appeal therefrom to any other office body or court whatsoever however all department heads after serving six 6 months may demand and receive written charges and the right to be heard thereon at a meeting of the council prior to the date on which hisher final removal shall take effect  but pending such hearing the city manager may suspend himher from office the decision of the council shall be final b prepare and submit to the council an annual budget and be responsible for its administration after adoption c prepare and submit to the council as of the end of the fiscal year a complete financial report for the preceding year d keep the council advised of the financial condition and future needs of the city and to recommend to the council for adoption such resolutions as heshe may deem necessary or expedient e perform such other duties as may be prescribed by this charter or required of himher by the council not inconsistent with this charter interference by the council prohibited neither the council nor any of its committees or members shall dictate the appointment of any person to or hisher removal from office or employment by the city manager or any of hisher subordinates or in any manner interfere in the appointment of officers and employees in the departments of the administrative service vested in the city manager by this charter article vi  city clerk appointment the city manager shall appoint the city clerk with the approval of the council who shall give notice of meetings of the council keep the journal and minute book of its proceedings shall authenticate by hisher signature and record in full in a book kept and indexed for the purpose all ordinances and resolutions and shall perform such other duties as the city manager shall assign to himher and those elsewhere provided in this charter article vii  finances generally annual budget estimate the fiscal year of the city shall begin with the first day of october of each year and shall end with the 30th day of september of each year on or before the first day of august each year the city manager shall submit to the city council a budget estimate of the revenues of the city and the expenses of conducting the affairs thereof for the ensuing year this estimate shall be compiled from detailed information obtained from the departments divisions and offices of the city in a format provided by the city manager or as required by the city council the estimate shall be as nearly uniform as possible for the main functional divisions of such departments divisions and offices and shall give the following information a an itemized estimate of the expense required by each department division and office b comparison of such estimates with the corresponding items of expenditure for the last fiscal year and with the expenditure of the current fiscal year plus an estimate of expenditures necessary to complete the current fiscal year c reasons for proposed increases or decreases of such items of expenditure compared with the current fiscal year d a separate schedule for each department showing the things necessary for the department to perform during the year and any desirable things it ought to do if possible e items of payroll increase as either additional pay to present employees or pay for more employees f a statement of the total probable income of the city from taxes and all other sources for the periods covered by the estimate g the amount required for interest on the citys debt for sinking fund and for maturing serial bonds as well as the reserves required h the total amount of outstanding city debts with a schedule of maturities on bond issues i such other information as may be required by the city council or the city manager j a projection of the future capital improvement needs of the city for at least the next three 3 years annual appropriation ordinance upon receipt of the city managers estimate the city council shall have prepared an appropriation ordinance using the city managers estimate as a basis provisions shall be made for a public hearing on the appropriation ordinance before the city council following the public hearing and before final adoption of the appropriation ordinance a summary of the information in such ordinance shall be published in the official newspaper of the city the city council shall not adopt the appropriation ordinance until at least ten 10 days after such publication but shall adopt the appropriation ordinance no later than september 30 of each year in the event the budget is not adopted by october 1 an ordinance shall be adopted approving a onemonth budget equal to onetwelfth  112  of the lesser of the current budget or the proposed budget in the event the budget is still not adopted at the end of such onemonth period the same procedure shall be repeated for adoption of another onemonth budget transfer of appropriations the city council may at any time authorize transfers of unreserved fund balances and unencumbered appropriations from one 1 department or fund to another department or fund except for transfers from enterprise funds to other funds a threefourths 34 vote of the entire city council shall be required to transfer unreserved fund balances andor unencumbered appropriations from enterprise funds appropriation of excess revenue if at any time the total accruing revenue of the city shall be in excess of the total estimated income thereof as set forth in the annual budget estimate in compliance with f of this the charter the city council may from time to time appropriate such excess to any such use as will not conflict with any specific use for which such revenue accrued expenditures only pursuant to appropriations no money shall be drawn from the city treasury nor shall any obligation for the expenditure of money be incurred except pursuant to appropriations made by the city council at the close of each fiscal year the unencumbered balances of each appropriation shall revert to the fund from which it was appropriated and shall be subject to future appropriation accounts of appropriations accounts shall be kept for each item of appropriation made by the city council  and every warrant on the city treasury shall state specifically against which of such items the warrant is drawn each such account shall show in detail the appropriations made thereto by the city council the amount drawn thereon the unpaid obligation charged against it and the unencumbered balance to the credit thereof payment of claims no claim against the city shall be paid unless it is evident by a voucher approved for payment by the city manager  hence such city manager and hisher surety shall be liable to the city for all loss or damage sustained by the city by reason of hisher negligence or corrupt approval of any such claim the city manager shall examine all payrolls bills and other claims and demands against the city and shall issue no warrant for payment unless heshe feels that the claim is in proper form correctly computed and duly approved  that it is justly and legally due and payable  that an appropriation has been made therefor which has not been exhausted or that the payment has been otherwise legally authorized  and that there is money in the city treasury to make payment the city manager may investigate any claim and for that purpose may summon before himher any officer agent or person and examine himher upon oath or affirmation relative thereto which oath or affirmation heshe may administer the city manager shall not authorize payment of any item for which no appropriation has been made at the fund level or for the payment of which there is not a sufficient balance in the proper fund appropriation or which is otherwise contrary to law or ordinance monies certified in treasury no contract agreement or other obligation involving the expenditure of money shall be entered into nor shall any ordinance resolution or order for the expenditure of money be passed by the city council or be authorized by any officer of the city except in the cases hereinafter specified unless the city manager has determined that the money required for such contract agreement obligation or expenditure is in the city treasury to the credit of the fund from which it is to be drawn and not appropriated for any other purpose the sum so encumbered shall not thereafter be considered unappropriated until the city is discharged from the contract agreement or obligation for the purposes of this monies expected to be received within a fiscal year shall be deemed to be in the city treasury for such fiscal year obligations  when void all contracts agreements or other obligations entered into all ordinances passed and resolutions contrary to the preceding be void and no person whatever shall have any claim or demand against the city thereunder  nor shall the city council or any officer of the city waive or qualify the limits fixed by any ordinance resolution or order as provided in of this the charter or fasten upon the city any liability whatsoever in excess of such limits or relieve any party from an exact compliance with hisher contract under such ordinance resolution or order  provided that this not apply in the case of public disaster calling for extraordinary emergency expenditures independent audit the city council shall cause an independent audit to be made of the books of account records and transactions of all the administrative departments of the city at least once yearly at the end of each fiscal year such audit shall be made by one 1 or more certified public accountants who for the three 3 preceding years have held a certificate or certificates issued by the state board of accountancy of the state of texas the auditor or auditors to make the said audit shall be selected by the city council shall be responsible to the city council shall serve in such capacity at the will of the city council and may be removed at any time by the city council they shall have no personal interest directly or indirectly in the financial affairs of the city or any of its officers  and any auditor may be employed whether a resident of the city or not notwithstanding the provisions of of this charter the duties of the auditor or auditors so appointed shall include the certification of the balance sheet exhibiting the assets and liabilities of the city such balance sheet shall be supported by the departmental schedules and schedules for each utility publicly owned or operated summaries of income and expenditures supported by detailed schedules and also comparisons in proper classifications with the last previous year the report of such auditor or auditors shall be submitted to the city council within the time period following the close of the fiscal period as required by state law such report shall be kept among the permanent records of the city such auditor or auditors so appointed shall not maintain or keep any of the citys accounts or records article viii  finance administration department of finance there shall be a department of finance the head of which shall be the city manager or hisher appointee who shall be known as the director of finance said director shall provide a bond with such surety and in such amount as the council may require the premium on such bond shall be paid by the city director of finance  powers and duties the director of finance shall administer all financial affairs of the city under the direction of the city manager to that end the director of finance shall have the authority and be required to maintain a complete system of financial controls that address the financial transactions for all agencies and departments of the city including the investment of funds and the recording monitoring and reporting of all revenues receipts disbursements allocations assets and liabilities such system shall meet all applicable standards required by the state and federal governments and yearend financial statements shall be prepared in conformance with generally accepted accounting principles relating to governmental accounting banking the city council shall in cooperation with the city manager select and designate a responsible financial institutions as a depository for the monies and funds of the city where the director of finance shall at all times promptly deposit and maintain the money funds and other valuable securities delivered to hisher custody the council may at any time within its judgment select and designate more than one 1 depository the financial institution shall be designated by the council in accordance with such regulations and subject to such requirements as to security for deposits and interest thereon as established by state law and city ordinance all interest on money so deposited shall accrue to the benefit of the city all checks for the withdrawal of money from the city depositories shall be signed by the city manager and countersigned by the mayor or mayor pro tem in the absence of the city manager checks may be signed by the city clerk or some other officer designated by the council by resolution purchases and contracts all purchases made and contracts executed by the city shall be made in accordance with the requirements of this charter and all applicable requirements of the constitution and laws of the state of texas all contracts for purchases or expenditures must be expressly approved in advance by the city council except that the city council may by ordinance confer upon the city manager the general authority to contract for expenditures without further approval of the city council for all budgeted items the cost of which does not exceed the constitutional and statutory requirements for competitive bidding article ix  taxation power to levy assess and collect an annual property tax the city council shall have the power under the provision of state law to levy assess and collect an annual tax upon taxable property within the city to the maximum extent permitted by the constitution and general laws of the state of texas article x  issuance and sale of bonds issuance of bonds and warrants all bonds and warrants of the city shall be authorized and issued in accordance with the applicable general laws and constitution of the state of texas article xi  ordinances definition and purpose any rule law decree authoritative direction public regulation or provision passed or adopted by the council not expressly defined by this charter shall hereinafter be known and referred to as an ordinance it shall be the purpose of an ordinance to supplement the provisions of this charter provide for municipal legislation establish local policy authorize the granting of franchises and otherwise prescribe the provisions of regulation and disposition of other matters not specifically referred to herein enactment enacting clause the method of introduction consideration and disposition of any proposed ordinance resolution rule or regulation shall conform to and be covered by the provisions of of this charter except as otherwise provided herein every ordinance passed by the council shall begin with the following heading be it ordained by the city of groves general prior to this charter the the city of groves and all ordinances resolutions rules and regulations of said city heretofore ordained passed adopted or enacted that are in force at the time this charter becomes effective and are not in conflict herewith shall remain in full force and effect until amended or appealed provided the same were valid and authorized by the charter under which they were enacted reading and prior notification except as otherwise provided herein it shall not be necessary to the validity of any ordinance that prior notification be given or that it shall be read more than one 1 time or considered at more than one 1 session of the council penal ordinances  publication the city clerk shall give notice of the passage of every ordinance imposing any penalty fine imprisonment or forfeiture for violation of its provisions by causing the ordinance or a descriptive caption or title thereof stating in summary the purpose of the ordinance and the penalty for violation thereof to be published one 1 time in a newspaper of general circulation in the city of groves within ten 10 days after the passage thereof publication of ordinances unless otherwise provided herein publication of ordinances shall not be necessary  however the council may authorize such publication as it may deem to be advisable provided said authorization is approved by a majority of the council present and provided said authorization is made at the same session in which the ordinance is passed franchise ordinances  publication all ordinances granting or confirming a franchise or working agreement shall be accepted in writing by the grantees and before taking effect shall be published as otherwise provided in this charter  the cost of such publication shall be borne by the grantees of such franchise or working agreement effective dates ordinances not requiring publication shall take effect from and after their passage unless otherwise therein expressly provided ordinances requiring publication shall take effect from and after the last required publication except as otherwise provided in this charter enrollment every ordinance passed by the council shall be enrolled by the city clerk as soon as practicable after its passage codification of ordinances the city council shall have the power to cause the ordinances of the city to be printed in code form as often as the council may deem advisable  and such printed code when adopted by the council shall be in full force and effect without the necessity of publishing the same or any part thereof in a newspaper all printed ordinances or codes of ordinances shall be admitted as evidence in all courts and shall have the same force and effect as would the original ordinance article xii  initiative referendum and recall initiativepower of the electors shall have power to propose any ordinance except an ordinance appropriating money or authorizing the levy of taxes and to adopt or reject the same at the polls initiativepetition any proposed ordinance may be submitted to the city council in the form in which the petitioner desires the same to be passed by a petition filed with the city clerk in the following manner a any elector shall make application to the city clerk and file an intention to circulate a petition giving the date of the application and the proposed ordinance to be circulated unless the final petition with the required number of signatures is returned within twenty 20 days from the date of such application it shall not be received for any purpose b the petition must contain the names and signatures of a number of qualified voters of the city equal to ten percent 10% of the qualified voters that appeared on the latest available county voter registration list as of the date of the last general municipal election c to be valid a petition submitted for the purpose of complying with this contain 1 each signers printed name date of birth voter registration number residence address date of signing and signature  2 on each page the text of the proposed ordinance to be circulated  and 3 on each page the name of the person circulating the petition  which person must be an elector of the city d every person circulating any page of a petition shall file with the city clerk a sworn notarized statement containing hisher name date of birth address and the statement i circulated this petition i am an elector of the city of groves the signers freely signed this petition any petition applicable to the same issue voted on within the six 6 month period immediately preceding the date of submission of such petition shall be rejected by the city clerk initiativeduties of the clerk all papers comprising a petition shall be assembled and filed with the city clerk as one 1 instrument within ten 10 days after a petition is filed the city clerk shall determine whether each paper of the petition has the proper statement of the circulator and whether the petition is signed by a sufficient number of qualified electors the city clerk shall declare any petition paper entirely invalid which fails to conform to any of the provisions of above after completing hisher examination of the petition the city clerk shall certify the result thereof to the city council at its next regular meeting if the petition is found by the clerk to be insufficient it shall be returned to the person filing same a petition may be amended within ten 10 days after notice of insufficiency the finding of the insufficiency of a petition shall not prejudice the filing of a new petition for the same purpose initiativeconsideration by city council whenever the city council receives a certified initiative petition from the city clerk it shall consider same and shall either a pass said ordinance within thirty 30 days after date of clerks certificate of sufficiency to the petition  or b submit said proposed ordinance to a vote of the people at the next uniform election date as prescribed by the texas election which date is at least sixty 60 days after the date of the city clerks certification to the city council initiativeresults of election if a majority of the electors voting on a proposed initiative ordinance shall vote in favor thereof such ordinance shall thereupon become a valid and binding ordinance of the city of groves initiativeamendments initiated ordinances adopted by the electors may be amended or repealed as is the case of other ordinances provided that no such ordinance shall be amended in such manner as to defeat its purpose  nor may such ordinance be repealed sooner than six 6 months after its enactment referendumpower of the electors shall have power to approve or reject at the polls any ordinance passed by the city council or submitted by the city council to a vote of the electors except an ordinance making the annual tax levy or an ordinance authorizing the issuance of bonds which have been authorized by a vote of the people such power being known as the referendum referendumpetition  effect the referendum petition shall conform to the provisions of herein and be certified by the city clerk to the city council as provided in hereof if a referendum petition is found sufficient and so certified to the city council the said ordinance shall thereupon be suspended from going into operation  or further action thereunder shall be suspended if it shall have gone into effect until and unless approved by the electors as herein provided referendumconsideration of petition by city council upon receipt of the city clerks certificate the council shall proceed to reconsider said ordinance or part thereof sought to be repealed if upon such reconsideration the ordinance or part thereof is not repealed it shall be submitted to the electors at the next uniform election date as prescribed by the texas election which date is at least sixty 60 days after the date of the city clerks certification to the city council referendumresults of election if when submitted to a vote of the electors any such referred ordinance be not approved by a majority of those voting thereon it shall be deemed repealed form of ballot for initiated and referred ordinances ordinances submitted to a vote of the electors in accordance with the initiative and referendum provisions of this charter shall be submitted by ballot which shall state the title of the ordinance to be voted on and shall have below the title the following propositions one above the other in the order indicated for the  against the  any number of ordinances may be voted on at the same election and may be submitted on the same ballot recallgeneral the mayor or any member of the city council or any elected official of the city may be removed from office by recall recallprocedure any elector of the city of groves may make and file with the city clerk an affidavit containing the names of the officers whose removal is sought and a statement of the grounds for removal the clerk shall thereupon deliver to the elector making such affidavit copies of petition blanks demanding such removal the clerk shall keep a sufficient number of such printed petition blanks on hand for distribution such blanks when issued by the city clerk shall bear the signature of that officer and be addressed to the city council and shall be numbered dated and indicate the name of the person to whom issued the petition blanks when issued shall also indicate the number of such blanks issued and the name of the officer whose removal is sought the city clerk shall enter in a record to be kept in hisher office the name of the elector to whom the petition blanks were issued and the number issued to said person recallpetitions the recall petition to be effective must be returned and filed with the city clerk within twenty 20 days after the filing of the affidavit required in herein  and it must be signed by qualified electors of the city equal to at least ten percent 10% of the total number of qualified voters of the city that appeared on the latest available county voter registration list as of the date of the last general municipal election said petition shall conform to the provisions of herein no petition papers shall be accepted as part of a petition unless it bears the signature of the city clerk as required in herein recallelection each page comprising the petition shall be assembled and filed with the city clerk as one 1 instrument within ten 10 days after a petition is filed the city clerk shall determine whether each page of the petition complies with the requirements of herein and whether the petition is sufficient after completing the examination of the petition the city clerk shall certify the result thereof to the city council at its next regular meeting and notify the official sought to be recalled of such action if the petition is found by the city clerk to be insufficient it shall be returned to the person filing same along with a written statement concerning the reasons for the insufficiency the petition may be amended within ten 10 days after such notice of insufficiency the finding of the insufficiency of a petition shall not prejudice the filing of a new petition for the same purpose if the official whose removal is sought does not resign within five 5 days after notice from the city clerk of the sufficiency of the recall petition or amended recall petition the city council shall thereupon order and fix a date for holding a recall election any such election shall be held at the next uniform election date as prescribed by the texas election which date is at least sixty 60 days after the date of the city clerks certification to the city council recallballots in election ballots used in recall elections shall conform to the following requirements a with respect to each person whose removal is sought the question shall be submitted shall name of person be removed from the office of title of office by recall b immediately below each such question there shall be printed the two 2 following propositions one above the other in the order indicated for the recall of name of person against the recall of name of person recallresults of election if a majority of the votes cast at a recall election shall be against the recall of the officer named on the ballot heshe shall continue in office for the remainder of hisher unexpired term subject to recall as before if a majority of the votes cast at such an election be for the recall of the officer named on the ballot heshe shall regardless of any technical defects in the recall petition be deemed removed from office  and the vacancy shall be filled by the city council as in other vacancies recalllimitations no recall petition shall be filed against the mayor or a councilmember or any other elected officer of the city within six 6 months after heshe takes office nor in respect to an officer subjected to a recall election and not removed thereby until at least six 6 months after such election district judge may order election should the city council fail or refuse to order any of the elections as provided for in this when all the requirements for such election have been complied with by the petitioning electors in conformity with this the charter then it shall be the duty of any one 1 of the district judges of jefferson county upon proper application being made therefor to order such elections and to enforce the carrying into effect of the provisions of this this charter article xiii  law department the city attorney the city council shall appoint a person to serve as attorney that is duly licensed by the state of texas to be the city attorney the city attorney shall be entitled to compensation for services as established by the city council and shall serve at the pleasure of the city council the city attorney shall draft or approve as to legal form every ordinance proposed by the city council and shall review all contracts and other documents in which the city has an interest the city attorney or other attorneys selected by the city attorney with the approval of the city council shall represent the city in all litigation the city attorney shall be the legal advisor to the city and counsel for the city and all its officers and departments in the conduct of city business municipal court there shall be a court for the trial of misdemeanor offenses known as the municipal court of the city of groves with such powers and duties as are given and prescribed by the laws of the state of texas judge of the municipal court there shall be a judge of the municipal court who shall be appointed by a majority of the entire city council for a term of two 2 years heshe shall be a resident of the city of groves hisher compensation shall be fixed by the city council heshe may be removed by the city council for incompetency misconduct or malfeasance in the event of failure of the judge of the municipal court to act for any reason the city council may appoint an interim judge of the municipal court to act in hisher place and stead until the duly appointed judge of the municipal court returns to duty clerk of the court the city clerk shall be clerk of the municipal court heshe or hisher deputies shall have the power to administer oaths make certificates affix the seal of said court thereto and generally do and perform any and all acts usual and necessary by clerks of courts in issuing processes of said court and conducting the business thereof article xiv  administrative departments general the city council shall establish other departments and offices of the city by ordinance all of said departments shall be under the control of the city manager except where otherwise provided in this charter the city council may discontinue any department or office established by ordinance and may prescribe combine distribute or abolish the functions and duties of departments and offices  but no function or duty assigned by this charter to a particular department or office shall be abolished or assigned to any other department or office directors of departments at the head of each department there shall be a director who shall have supervision and control of the department subject to supervision and approval by the city manager except as specifically provided otherwise by this charter two 2 or more departments may be headed by the same individual the city manager may head one 1 or more departments and directors of departments may also serve as chiefs of divisions the work of each administrative department may be distributed among such divisions thereof as may be established by resolution of the city council upon the recommendation of the city manager directors of administrative departments  salary the directors of all administrative departments shall be appointed by the city manager unless otherwise provided in this charter and shall receive such compensation as shall be prescribed by the city council  and before entering upon the duties of the office shall if required by the council make bond in some responsible surety company acceptable to the city council for such amount as the council may prescribe the premium of which bond shall be paid by the city article xv  franchises general the ownership and control of the public streets highways alleys parks public places and all other real property of the city of groves are hereby declared to be inalienable to said city except by ordinance duly adopted by city council not in conflict with the provisions of this charter no act or omission of a city officer or agent shall be construed to confer grant renew extend or amend expressly or by estoppel implication or indirection any right franchise or easement affecting such public streets highways sidewalks alleys parks and other public places except as provided in this charter power to grant franchise the city council shall have power by ordinance to grant renew and extend all franchises of all public utilities of every character operating within the city of groves and with the consent of the franchise holder to amend same provided however any franchise granted shall be for a definite term not to exceed fifty 50 years franchise all ordinances granting amending renewing or extending franchises shall be presented in writing at three 3 separate regular meetings of the city council and shall not be finally adopted until approved upon final reading which shall be not less than thirty 30 days from the first reading after the passage of a franchise ordinance and before its effective date the full text of such ordinance shall be published once each week for four 4 consecutive weeks in the official newspaper of the city of groves  and the expense of such publication shall be borne by the prospective franchise holder transfer of franchise no public utility franchise shall be transferred by the holder thereof except with the approval of the city council expressed by ordinance franchise value not allowed in fixing reasonable rates and charges for public utility services within the city and in determining the just compensation to be paid by the city for public utility property which the city may acquire by condemnation or otherwise the value of a franchise granted by the city under this charter shall not be considered regulation of franchise every grant renewal extension or amendment of a public utility franchise whether so provided in the ordinances or not shall be subject to the right of the city council to a forfeit any such franchise by ordinance at any time for failure of the holder thereof to comply with the terms of the franchise such power shall be exercised only after written notice to the franchise holder stating wherein the franchise holder has failed to comply with the terms of the franchise and setting a reasonable time for the correction of such failure and shall be exercised only after hearing and after such reasonable time has expired b impose reasonable regulations to ensure safe efficient and continuous service to the public c require such expansion extension enlargement and improvement of plants and facilities as are necessary to provide adequate service to the public d require every franchise holder to furnish to the city without cost to the city full information regarding the location character size length and terminals of all facilities of such franchise holder in over and under the streets alleys and other public properties of the city and to regulate and control the location relocation and removal of such facilities e collect from every public utility operating within the city such proportion of the expense of excavating grading paving repaving constructing reconstructing draining repairing maintaining lighting sweeping and sprinkling the streets alleys ridges culverts viaducts and other public places of the city as represent the increased cost of such operation resulting from the occupancy of such public places by such public utility and such proportion of the cost of such operations as results from the damage to or the disturbance of such public places caused by such public utility  or to compel such public utility to perform at its own expense such operations as above listed which are made necessary by the occupancy of such public places by such utility or by damage to or disturbance of such public places caused by such utility f require every franchise holder to allow other public utilities to use its poles and other facilities including bridges and viaducts whenever in the judgment of the city council such use shall be in the public interest provided that in such an event a reasonable rental shall be paid to the owner of the facilities for such use provided further the inability of such public utilities to agree upon rental facilities or the rental amount to be paid therefore shall not be an excuse for failure to comply with such requirement by the city council g 1 require the keeping of accounts in such form as will accurately reflect the value of the property of each franchise holder which is used and useful in rendering its service to the public and the expenses receipts and profits of all kind of such franchise holder 2 examine and audit at any time during business hours the accounts and other records of any franchise holder 3 require reports on the operation of the utility which shall be in such form and contain such information as the city council shall prescribe h require that the public utility give notice to any subscriber to its service prior to the permanent or temporary discontinuance or disruption of such service by the public utility except in cases of emergency and to require that no officer agent servant or employee of the public utility nor any vehicles or equipment under their control shall make use of or go upon or across any private property within the city without first obtaining the permission of the owner or occupant of such property except in cases of emergency and to provide a penalty for the violation of such requirements i impose such other reasonable regulations restrictions requirements and conditions as may be deemed necessary or desirable to promote the health safety welfare or accommodations of the public franchise records within six 6 months after the effective date of this provision of the charter every public utility operating within the city and every owner of a public utility franchise within the city shall file with the city clerk certified copies of all franchises owned or claimed or under which such utility is operating within the city the city shall compile and maintain a public record of all public utility franchises regulation of rates the city council shall have full power except as otherwise provided by law after notice and hearing to regulate by ordinance the rates charges and fares of every public utility franchise holder operating within the city every franchise holder who shall request an increase in rates charges or fares shall have at the hearing of the city council called to consider such request the burden of establishing by clear competent and convincing evidence of the value of its investments properly allowable to service in the city and the amount and character of its expenses and revenues connected with the rendering of such service if upon such hearing the city council is not satisfied with the sufficiency of the evidence so furnished it shall be entitled to call upon such public utility for the furnishing of additional evidence at a subsequent date to which said hearing may be adjourned exceptions  spur tracks the provisions of of this to effective date of ordinance and publication thereof shall not be applicable to the granting of side track spur track or switch privileges to any franchiseholding railway company for the purpose of reaching and affording railway connections and switch privileges to the owners or users of any industrial site franchises granting these privileges shall take effect ten 10 days after their adoption on third and final reading  and the full text of such ordinance shall be published once in the official newspaper of the city of groves at the expense of the proponent of the franchise or working agreement power to regulate the city council shall have the power by ordinance to require any or all railroad companies operating any track or tracks upon or across any public streets of the city of groves to reduce such tracks below the level of the streets intersected or occupied by such tracks or to elevate such tracks above the level of the streets intersected or occupied by such tracks and to require the company or companies owning or operating such tracks to provide and maintain in good condition necessary and proper crossing for the public travel at intersecting streets or to remove any tracks from any street occupied by such tracks and to reroute same as designated in the ordinance provided the railway company involved be given thirty 30 days notice prior to the adoption of the ordinance present franchises to remain in force all franchises now legally in force shall remain in full force and effect for the remainder of the term designated therein  however all such franchises shall be subject to the provisions of this charter provided no vested rights are impaired thereby article xvi  general provisions publicity of records all records and accounts of every office department or agency of the city shall be open to inspection by any citizen any representative of a citizens organization or any representative of the press at all reasonable times and under reasonable regulations established by the city council conflict of interest except as permitted by state law no member of the council or any officer or employee of the city shall have a financial interest direct or indirect or by reason of ownership of stock in any corporation in any contract or in the sale to the city or to a contractor supplying the city of any land or rights of interest in any land material supplies or service any willful violation of this constitute malfeasance in office  and any officer or employee of the city found guilty thereof shall thereby forfeit hisher officer or position any violation of this the knowledge express or implied of the person or corporation contracting with the city shall render the contract voidable by the city manager or the city council oath of office every officer shall before entering upon the duties of hisher office take and subscribe to an official oath as prescribed in of the texas constitution as amended such oath shall be filed as provided by law and kept in the office of the city clerk citizens given preference in employment except as herein otherwise provided qualifications being equal citizens of groves shall be given preference in employment by the city as well as by any contractor doing work for the city under contract and such contractors shall pay the prevailing rate of wages paid for the class of work done  and qualifications prices and quality of material being equal citizens of groves shall be given preference in the awarding of all contracts over which the city has jurisdiction provided this not interfere with the system of purchasing supplies for the various departments by competitive bidding building code the city council shall adopt by ordinance technical codes that regulate the construction and improvement of buildings and structures within the city zoning ordinances for the purpose of promoting the health safety morals or general welfare of the city the council may by ordinance regulate the location height bulk and size of buildings and other structures the size of yards courts and other open spaces the density of population and the uses of buildings structures and land for trade industry business residence or other purposes such ordinances may provide that the zoning board of adjustment may in appropriate cases and subject to appropriate principles standards rules conditions and safeguards set forth in the ordinances make special exceptions to the terms of the zoning regulations in harmony with their general purpose and intent such ordinances may provide that the zoning board of adjustment may authorize variances from the strict application of the regulations in such situations and subject to such limitations as may be set forth in ordinances all of the powers granted by of the texas local government together with existing amendments and all amendments as hereinafter may be made relating to zoning in cities are hereby adopted and made a part of this charter power to remit penalties the city council shall have the right to remit in whole or in part any fine or penalty belonging to the city which may be imposed under any ordinance or resolution passed in pursuance of this charter power to settle claims the city council shall have the power to compromise and settle any and all claims and lawsuits of every kind and character in favor of or against the city including suits by the city to recover delinquent taxes provisions relating to assignment the property real and personal belonging to the city shall not be liable to be sold or appropriated under any writ execution or cost bill the funds belonging to the city in the hands of any person firm or corporation shall not be liable to garnishment attachment or sequestration  nor shall the city be liable to garnishment on account of any debt it may owe or funds or property it may have on hand or owing to any person neither the city nor any of its officers or agents shall be required to answer any such writ of garnishment or any account whatever the city shall not be obligated to recognize any assignment of wages or funds by its employees agents or contractors city not required to give security or execute bond it shall not be necessary in action suit or proceeding in which the city of groves is a party for any bond undertaking or security to be demanded or executed by or on behalf of said city in any of the state courts but in all such actions suits appeals or proceedings same shall be conducted in the same manner as if such bond undertaking or security had been given as required by law and said city shall be just as liable as if security of bond had been duly executed notice of claims before the city of groves shall be liable for the death or personal injuries of any person or for damage to or destruction of property of any kind the person injured if living or hisher representative if deceased or the owner hisher agent or attorney of the property damaged or destroyed shall give the city council notice in writing of such death injury damage or destruction duty verified by affidavit within six 6 months after same has been sustained stating specifically in such written notice when where and how the death injury damage or destruction occurred and the apparent extent of any such injury the amount of damages sustained the actual residence of the claimant by street and number on the date the claim is presented the actual residence of such claimant for six 6 months immediately preceding the occurrence of such death injury damage or destruction and the names and addresses of all witnesses upon whom it is relied to establish the claim for damages  and the failure to so notify the council within the time and manner specified herein shall exonerate excuse and exempt the city from any liability whatsoever no act of any officer or employee of the city shall waive compliance or estop the city from requiring compliance with the provisions of this to notice except the city council may waive compliance herewith by resolution duly adopted and evidenced by official minutes amending the charter amendments to this charter may be framed and submitted to the electors of the city by a charter commission in the manner provided by law for framing and submitting a new charter the city council may on its own motion in the absence of a petition and shall upon the petition of at least ten percent 10% of the qualified voters of this city submit any proposed amendment or amendments to this charter in the manner prescribed by the general law rearrangement and renumbering the city council shall have the power by ordinance to renumber and rearrange all articles paragraphs of the charter or any amendments thereto as it shall deem appropriate  and upon the passage of any such ordinance a copy thereof certified by the city clerk shall be forwarded to the secretary of state for filing separability clause if any part of this charter shall be held invalid by a court of competent jurisdiction such holding shall not affect the remainder of this charter nor the context in which such part of held invalid may appear except to the extent that an entire part of be inseparably connected in meaning and effect with the part of which such holding shall directly apply degrees of relationship  nepotism prohibitions except as may be permitted by state law the mayor members of the city council or the city manager may not appoint confirm the appointment of or vote for appointment or confirmation of the appointment of an individual to a position that is to be provided however this provision shall not affect officers or employees who were already employed by the city at the time when and officer who may be related within the prohibited degree takes office article xvii  city marshal general there shall be an office of city marshal whose duty shall be to enforce all general and specific laws of the state of texas and ordinances passed by the city council in a manner prescribed by the city council election and term the city marshal shall be elected by the qualified electors at large of the city of groves for the term of two 2 years heshe must meet the same qualifications as a candidate for mayor and will be subject to all provisions in this charter relating to elected officials the city marshal shall serve in hisher capacity as marshal on a fulltime basis certification within six 6 months after hisher election the city marshal shall obtain and maintain during hisher tenure of office a license and certification by the texas commission of law enforcement officers standards and education for a peace officer duties the city marshal shall be responsible to the city council for the performance of hisher duties but may be put on report to the council by the city attorney municipal court judge or city manager the city marshal or one of hisher deputies shall be on duty at all times heshe shall be removable only for incompetence malfeasance misfeasance neglect of duty or failure to meet the qualifications for office as prescribed by this charter heshe shall be removed only by a majority vote of the entire council but not before serving at least six 6 months of hisher term if removed heshe may demand that charges against himher be put in writing a copy given to himher and the right to be heard at a public meeting of the council within two 2 weeks after charges are filed the decision of the council based upon the results of such public hearing shall be final in the event of a vacancy by removal or otherwise the unexpired term of office shall be filled by a special election to be held on an authorized uniform election date occurring within fortyfive 45 days of the date of the vacancy unless no uniform election date within such period affords enough time to hold the election in the manner required by law in that case the election shall be held on the first authorized uniform election date occurring after the expiration of such period salary the salary of the city marshal shall be determined by the city council the equipment and other items deemed necessary for the performance of hisher duties will be furnished by the city council heshe may appoint hisher own deputies with the approval of the city council and the council shall set their compensation powers the city marshal shall have all of the powers vested in law enforcement officers by the constitution of the state of texas and the charter of groves texas interim city marshal in the event of the death resignation incapacity or removal of the city marshal the city council shall appoint a city marshal from the police department who shall serve until a city marshal can be duly elected as provided herein charter disposition table this dumping of refuse  and 2 five hundred dollars $50000 in all other cases arising under ordinances of the city b the municipal court shall have concurrent jurisdiction with any justice of the peace in expiration of three 3 days after any animal or fowl may have been impounded if the owner of such animal or fowl shall not have appeared and redeemed such animal or fowl the poundmaster shall advertise the same for sale at public auction on a date not earlier than three 3 days after the first publication of such advertisement each such advertisement shall describe the animal or fowl to be sold as clearly as possible shall name the date on which such animal or fowl was impounded shall state the amount of the pound fees which have accrued against such animal or fowl and shall name a definite date and hour at which the same is to be sold all notices of sales of impounded animals or fowl shall be posted for the full period of three 3 days at some public place within the city one of which places shall be the city hall another the public pound and the third shall be at some place which the poundmaster may select  61873 sameprocedure at each sale of unredeemed impounded animals or fowl the poundmaster shall sell for cash only and to the highest bidder and shall deliver to the purchaser a bill of sale in the name of the city which shall have impressed thereon by the city clerk the corporate seal of the city and shall be signed by both the city clerk and the poundmaster samedisposition of receipts in the event of the sale of any animal or fowl which has been impounded under the provisions of section 545 the poundmaster shall deduct from the price of said animal or fowl obtained at such sale the full amount of such lawful fees and charges as shall have accrued prior to the sale the remainder of such sale price shall be delivered by the poundmaster to the city clerk such money so paid to the treasurer shall be held by the clerk in a separate account for a period of one year from the date of such sale and if the owner of any animal or fowl so sold shall appear within the year and establish his ownership to the satisfaction of the treasurer the full amount so held shall be delivered to such claimant upon his executing a receipt for the amount and a full release of all claim against the city for the value of the animal or fowl in the event that such money be not claimed within one year by a person who can show his ownership then the full amount of such money shall be placed in the general fund of the city records to be kept by poundmaster the poundmaster shall keep a book in which he shall carefully record the following information concerning each animal or fowl which may be impounded therein to wit a the date on which such animal or fowl was impounded  b the name of the owner if known  c a full and clear description of the animal or fowl  d the date on which such animal or fowl was discharged from the pound  e the name of the person to whom delivered  f the date on which such animal or fowl was advertised for sale  g the places where notice of sale were posted  h the number of days that notices were posted before sale  i the price at which such animal or fowl was sold  j the person to whom sold and his place of residence  k the amount of charges accrued against such animal or fowl before sale  l the amount of charges accrued
