exhibit a standard specifications for all water and sewerage system improvements public building improvements and other general construction projects 1 texas highway department the city of groves texas hereby adopts the 1962 standard specifications for road and bridge construction as adopted by the state highway department of texas  to be used to prepare specifications for specific projects to be accomplished in the city of groves all reference to the texas highway department shall be deleted when preparing city standard specifications 2 american public works association the city of groves texas hereby adopts the standard specifications for public works construction 1967 edition these standard specifications are to be used to prepare specifications of specific projects to be accomplished in the city of groves and will require updating and modification on a continuing basis to reflect conditions and requirements within this city 3 american water works association the awwa prepared and published standard specifications for water and sewerage system operations maintenance construction and improvements and the city of groves hereby recognizes the awwa as an authority in this field and approves the use of this organizations standard specifications within the city of groves on related projects and work 4 statement of policy a it is the intention of the city council of the city of groves that the standard specifications of the above three recognized authorities be made available for use by the city of groves on all types of work projects operation and maintenance in water and sewer system improvements public works public buildings and other general construction projects the respective department heads ie director of public works are charged with the responsibility to modify adapt and keep on a current basis these standard specifications for use by the city current editions of all specifications used by the city standard specifications will be kept on hand and clearly marked approved by the department head these standard specifications as changed by the city shall be presented with and made a part of the formal plans and specifications for a project when it is presented for public approval by the city council b it is also adopted as a city policy that the departments of water and sewer public works and planning are hereby charged with the maintenance of these standard specifications and standard engineering drawings included herein as the city standards and are hereafter charged with the maintenance and updating of these city standards and the development of new standards in the future standard specifications for water system improvements the specifications shown below are considered to be the minimum standards required by the city of groves for subdivision of land for residential commercial andor industrial development for city force account projects and for contracts let by the city of groves and for the city of groves by other governmental agencies 1 design criteria all water lines shall be six 6 inches in diameter or larger and installed in a looped system for residential development for multifamily commercial andor industrial development an eight 8 inch line with a looped system shall be required as a minimum the director of public works may require larger diameter water lines where the engineering design dictates more volume due to consumption andor fire protection demands fire hydrants are to be located as required by the state fire insurance board and shall be equipped with valved lead the director of public works city engineer and the fire marshal shall approve the water line layout and fire hydrant locations for each development based upon consumption and protection requirements fire hydrants shall be placed from two 2 to four 4 feet behind curb lines with steamer connections running parallel with the street line 2 guidelines the city will use as guidelines for water system installation those requirements set out in the texas state department of health book design criteria for water systems 3 materials the standard material for water line installation in the city of groves shall be asbestoscement pipe with cement lined cast iron fittings and valves concrete lined steel pipe or cast iron water lines will be specified for street roadway drainage ditch crossings where required by the city public works director 4 coordination with city the water superintendent shall determine all special water meter locations locations of points where taps will be made to the citys water system the cost to the developer for any work to be performed by city forces and any other special requirements related to new development the issuance of a building permit does not constitute an agreement by the city nor an acknowledgment of the city that water service can and will be provided a development 5 installation water lines will generally be located on the front of residential lots and in open areas of multifamily commercial andor industrial developments to provide good access to water meters valves and fire hydrants 6 tests water mains shall be tested hydrostatically and evaluation of leakage made from time and pressures as follows 1 100 psi test for 24 hours or 2 125 psi test for 16 hours or 3 150 psi test for 8 hours the high 150 psi test being preferred bacteriological test shall be performed with city assistance in accordance with texas state department of health requirements tests shall be performed without cost to the city guidelines for the design construction testing and inspection of sanitary sewer systems a design 1 maximum depth of sewers no main or trunk sanitary sewer line shall have a depth greater than 12 feet below average ground elevation the line passes unless specifically permitted as a special condition to the plans andor specifications for a particular project such special condition shall indicate that all factors of cost service and other pertinent engineering facts justify a line of greater depth 2 minimum depth of sewers a no main or trunk sanitary sewer line shall have a depth of cover less than 3 feet below average ground elevation the line passes b in the event local ground conditions exist which prevent compliance with the above specified depth a minimum depth of less than 3 feet may be used if approved by the superintendent of water and sewer 3 minimum size of sewers design of sanitary sewer mains shall be based on a flow capacity of 4500 gallons per acre per day but in no case shall be of a size less than 8 inches 4 manholes a manholes shall be placed at all change ingrade or alignment and maximum spacing of manholes shall not exceed 400 feet under normal conditions should existing conditions such as street gutters underground lines etc prevent specified spacing a maximum spacing of 600 feet may be used if approved by superintendent of water and sewer b all manholes shall conform to standards adopted and approved by the public works department  such standards to be attached to and become a part of these specifications all manholes shall be coated inside with an acid resistant material  18 inch epoxy duracrete or approved equal c sewer lines entering or leaving manholes shall be designed to snugly fit preformed or fielddrilled openings in manholes all openings of manholes shall be coated with epoxy material specified above 5 detention time for sewerage detention time for sewerage on any new system to any existing lift station andor sewer system shall not exceed one hour in no case shall detention time exceed two hours from any new system to existing treatment plant without approval by the superintendent of water and sewer  unless another method is provided to prevent sewerage from becoming septic 6 joint deflection maximum joint deflection shall be in accordance with astm standards applicable to the type of pipe specified b materials 1 no sanitary sewer line of concrete or orangeburg shall be acceptable to the city the city reserves the right to accept or reject any type pipe andor jointing material as it deems necessary for good construction 2 jointing material shall be in accordance with astm standards applicable to the type of pipe specified 3 inside diameters of sanitary sewer pipe shall be as indicated on plans andor specifications within tolerances specified in astm standards applicable to the type of pipe specified 4 the city reserves the right to reject any materials delivered to the job site in a damaged condition or any material not complying with specifications c testing 1 the city reserves the right to require contractors to submit alternate bids on sewer work based on the method of testing to be used alternate bids will be submitted on the following methods of testing a exfiltration andor infiltration b the city of groves standard air test the city may accept or reject any or all bids as it deems necessary 2 allowable exfiltration and infiltration rates on sanitary sewer lines being tested shall not exceed 200 gallons per inch of diameter per mile per day regardless of the method of testing required no more than 1200 feet of pipe shall be installed under any one operation before testing 3 if any section of line fails to meet required tests contractor shall provide continuous photographs of entire section to determine areas where corrective work needs to be done to place the line in proper shape 4 all exfiltration tests if required shall be performed under a line head of 6 feet to the top of the pipe 5 exfiltration andor infiltration tests if required shall be performed upon the completion of each section as specified above under a method agreed upon by the city and contractor but in no case shall be less than the 200 gallon basis d inspection 1 all contracts for design construction inspecting and testing of sanitary sewer work entered into by the city shall designate responsibility for furnishing inspectors on the project the number of inspectors if furnished by the citys consulting engineers shall be approved by the department of public works 2 no major item of sanitary sewer work shall be performed under contract in the absence of a qualified inspector furnished by the city or their consultants 3 all inspectors on sanitary sewer work whether furnished by the city or their consultants shall have had not less than three 3 years experience in the field of water andor sewer line construction 4 all work shall be performed in accordance with and as directed by the city engineer director of public works and sewer superintendent e award of contract 1 prior to award of any contract the city manager and staff shall review plans and procedures contract documents etc to determine adequacy of design and acceptability of proposed facility 2 no contract shall be awarded by the city until such time as all permits easements or rightofway necessary for construction have been acquired or are in the process of condemnation 3 any proposed easements to be secured by the city exempting previously platted subdivisions shall have the following minimum widths a 10 feet for any easement proposed to contain only one utility b 20 feet for any easement proposed to contain two or more utilities f plans and specifications plans and specifications for sanitary sewer construction shall be approved by the public works department prior to presentation to city council for acceptance standard specifications for street construction included herein are the minimum standard city of groves street construction standards and specifications 1 all streets constructed in groves shall conform to the details and requirements shown on the standard street cross  and the master street and highway plan for groves unless specifically changed and permitted herein 2 all reinforced concrete pavements shall have minimum thickness of six 6 inches and shall be designed to support the traffic loads and conditions required by the master street plan for groves reinforcing wire mesh of 6 gage by 6 gage or approved equivalent reinforcing bar steel shall be used as a minimum unless design requirements are higher standard pavement and joint details approved by the city of groves shall be followed a comprehensive strength of 3000 pounds per square inch within 28 days is required for all concrete the subgrade must be undisturbed native soil with a maximum of two 2 inches of compacted sand cushion below the concrete pavement curbs can be placed monolithically or by dowell anchor bars or pins curb design will follow existing city standard design and shall be placed to provide a minimum grade of 020% 3 flexible base streets shall when permitted in writing by the director of public works conform to these requirements the base shall be twentyfour 24 feet wide and eight 8 inches thick compacted to a 95% proctor density the subbase material shall be shaped rolled and compacted to a 90% proctor density prior to placing any base material surface course and prime course of twentytwo 22 feet in width shall be applied during the year only between april and october the transverse slope on the surface will be from onefourth 14 to onehalf 12 inch per foot there will be an eight 8 foot shoulder provided between the edge of the base
